qmt.visualization package¶

Submodules¶

qmt.visualization.density_1d_plot module¶

qmt.visualization.density_1d_plot.generate_1d_density_plot(generic_task, filename, dask_client=None)[source]¶

qmt.visualization.density_2d_plot module¶

qmt.visualization.density_2d_plot.generate_2d_density_plot(generic_task, filename, dask_client=None)[source]¶

This function takes as input a 2D ThomasFermi or SchrodingerPoisson task, and a filename. It then saves all of the data relevant to this plot.

qmt.visualization.mobility_plots module¶

qmt.visualization.mobility_plots.generate_mobility_plots(generic_task, filename, x_axis_tag, x_axis_units, dask_client=None)[source]¶

This function takes as input a mobility task, a filename, the tag which is the x axis of the eventual plot, and the units of the x-axis as a string. It then saves all of the data relevant to this plot.

qmt.visualization.plot module¶

qmt.visualization.plot.plot(filename, hv)[source]¶

qmt.visualization.plot_helpers.save_relevant_data(generic_task, filename, dask_client, get_relevant_data, plot_type)[source]¶
